messages.title: Action Not Words
messages.content: Dan Roper says 'There have been too many empty election promises […] I will provide leadership on this issue and will start putting pressure on the Minister as soon as I am elected. This is too important to give up.'

messages.title: Crushing Win For Lib Dems!
messages.content: Dan Roper with Taverham winner Nich Starling. Dan said 'The Tories have taken Broadland for granted, but this Lib Dem victory shows….'

messages.title: More Empty Promises?
messages.content: Dan Roper says 'I am steadfast in my opposition to the Rackheath development and stood on the with a placard alongside local protesters before the vital council meeting. I do hope the Tory MP is supporting residents like he says he is and this is not an empty pre-election promise'

messages.title: Tories Cave In On Unitary Norwich
messages.content: Dan Roper, 'The Tories sat on their hands in Parliament after making a lot of noise and spending proposals to the detriment of Norfolk and the Tories failed to move from their proposal.'

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Dan Roper is against the Rackheath development, expressing steadfast opposition and demonstrating this stance alongside local protesters.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Dan Roper's victory alongside Nich Starling in Taverham is highlighted as a sign of Liberal Democrat support in Broadland.

issues.immigration: Dan Roper references immigration policy and expresses caution against extreme positions, such as those of the BNP.

housing.content: Dan Roper is steadfast in his opposition to the Rackheath development, which implies concerns about housing development in the area.

politicalExperience.achievements: Working to reduce crime and improve public service, with many varied individuals who have committed serious crimes, every crime that I have helped solve is a prevention.

images.caption: Dan Roper with Taverham winner Nich Starling.

leaflet.additionalNotes: There is a Q&A section titled 'ASK DAN' where Dan Roper answers questions about his views on local and national issues such as education, immigration, and his own political experience.
